context: Based on your latest scan and blood work, we need to make an important change to your plan.
explanation: Your excellent response ({{follicle_count}} follicles, E2: {{e2_level}}) puts you at risk for OHSS (Ovarian Hyperstimulation Syndrome). OHSS causes bloating, pain, and in severe cases, hospitalization. To keep you safe, we're switching to a 'freeze-all' strategy - we'll retrieve your eggs, freeze all embryos, and do transfer in a future cycle when your body has recovered.
next_steps: Trigger shot tonight with {{trigger_type}} (different than planned). Retrieval on schedule. All embryos frozen. FET in 1-2 months.
reassurance: I know this feels like a setback, but frozen embryos actually have HIGHER success rates than fresh transfers! And your safety comes first. This decision gives you the best chance of a healthy pregnancy. ðŸ’š
call_to_action: Drink LOTS of water (3-4 liters/day), high-protein diet, NO strenuous activity. Call IMMEDIATELY if severe bloating/pain/vomiting.

Many of my patients who had cancelled cycles went on to have successful pregnancies with adjusted protocols.
